metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18520 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An Invalid Memory Address Dereference exists in the function elf_end inlibelf in elfutils through v0.174. Although eu-size is intended to supportar files inside ar files, handle_ar in size.c closes the outer ar filebefore handling all inner entries. The vulnerability allows attackers tocause a denial of service (application crash) with a crafted ELF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

debuginfod - 0.176-1.1
elfutils - 0.176-1.1
libasm1 - 0.176-1.1
libdebuginfod-common - 0.176-1.1
libdebuginfod1 - 0.176-1.1
libdw1 - 0.176-1.1
libelf1 - 0.176-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: elfutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.176-1.1').
